channel.title: [PI] Multi Attacking Npc's
channel.description:
Hey, So my problem is that i want to make this boss be able to get attacked by more than one person, like the King Black Dragon so i went into "player.java" and below the
[code=java]public boolean inMulti() { if(isInArd()) { return true; }[/code]
I added:
[code=java] (absX >= 2360 && absX <= 2440 && absY >= 3060 && absY <= 3125) || [/code]
Now i have the Multi Attack sign in the botton right corner, but still only one person can attack that npc and i get the message "This monster is already in combat" Does anyone know how to fix this, or is it the wrong place to put the code? Im using PI for my base.
Thanks Roflmfao

item.title: [PI] Multi Attacking Npc's
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

It’s not done like that.
Npchandler.java Not gonna show you how to do it 100% but you can get the idea. Pretty sure its this.

public void attackNPC(int c, int i) { if(npcs[i] != null) { if (npcs[i].isDead) return; if (!npcs[i].[size=10pt]inMulti[/size]() && npcs[i].underAttackBy > 0 && npcs[i].underAttackBy != npcs[c].npcId) { npcs[i].killerId = 0; return; }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Multi Attacking Npc's
item.dc:creator: @laurensman laurensman
item.description:
@laurensman wrote:

hmm try npc.class also… not just player.class, because in npc.class theres the same thing and that makes the npc be able to be multi hit.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Multi Attacking Npc's
item.dc:creator: @roflmfao roflmfao
item.description:
@roflmfao wrote:

Hey,
So my problem is that i want to make this boss be able to get attacked by more than one person, like the King Black Dragon so i went into “player.java” and below the

public boolean inMulti() { if(isInArd()) { return true; }

I added:

(absX >= 2360 && absX <= 2440 && absY >= 3060 && absY <= 3125) ||

Now i have the Multi Attack sign in the botton right corner, but still only one person can attack that npc and i get the message “This monster is already in combat” Does anyone know how to fix this, or is it the wrong place to put the code?
Im using PI for my base.

Thanks
Roflmfao

Read full topic
